history.text: How did you like the movie?
Its great, it has so many big stars in it!
Jim Carrey, Morgan Freeman and Jennifer Anniston.
I know! I can't believe they were able to get so many good actors
Does Carrey play a serious or a funny character?
Yeah I know, this is known as one of Jim Carrey's best movies!
He plays a funny character, with some minor serious times.
I really enjoy the depth of his characters! And Morgan Freeman? He's great in everything.
Morgan Freeman is great! I really do love the comedy in this movie.
Does Freeman have to pull off a funny character?
He is more serious, but still great!
I think his God voice is spot on.
I cannot believe this was made in 2003, it seems like yesterday!
The voice is great, Morgan Freeman has a classic voice!
I know! and to think I wasn't even in high school yet! And I can still re-watch and laugh out loud. Lassoing the moon is a nice move.
Oh geez, Im old I was 23! I dont remember Steve Carrell in this, but I see he was.
He worked with him! I really like Carrell in Anchorman! I forgot he had such a small role in this movie
Yeah, I didnt realize. This got really good reviews from critics, which isnt always the case with comedies, I wish they made more like this.
I wonder how intense it would be to hear prayers in your ears at all times like Carrey has to in the movie.
That would be crazy weird, Im not so sure I could handle that.
And, rotten tomatoes gives it a 49% but I think they miss the mark on a lot of things.
I dont really understand the whole rotten tomato score. It doesnt make sense to me.
Did you think it was funny when Bruce uses his powers to make his girlfriends chest a *bit* bigger. As a woman, I laughed pretty hard.
I totally agree about Rotten Tomatoes. They seem really bias, but in a way I don't understand
Yes, that was hillarious!
I honestly think I might watch this again tonight.
It's been years.
I like how he creates an email system to receive prayers, haha!
But doesn't his email go insane?! Way worse than work emails.
yeah really!

uid1response.feedback: I already loved this movie, but talking to someone else about it helped remind me why.
